inclusion: Connect a DC power source to include the Fibaro Flood Sensor into the Z-Wave network in autoinclusion mode or triple click TMP button for manual inclusion.
label: FGFS101
overview: Fibaro Flood Sensor is a universal flood and temperature sensor. Device can be battery (ca. 2 years battery life) or VDC powered (12 or 24 VDC).
wakeup: Triple click TMP button  (think it's really a quad click)

parameters.label: Alarm Cancellation Delay
parameters.description: Time alarm still indicated after alarm condition has ceased
parameters.overview: Time period (in seconds) that an alarm will still be indicated after the alarm condition has ceased.

parameters.label: Acoustic/visual signals On/Off in case of flooding
parameters.overview: Parameter allows for LED indicator and acoustic alarm deactivation in case of flooding detection

options.label: Acoustic alarm inactive, visual alarm active
Acoustic alarm active, visual alarm inactive

parameters.label: Type alarm frame sent to 1-st assoc group
parameters.description: Type of cmd frame sent in case of flooding
parameters.overview: Parameter determines a type of command frame sent by the Sensor in case flooding has been detected or cancelled

parameters.label: Forced Level of Dimming group 1
parameters.description: Parameter specifying forced level of dimming f. asoc grp 1
parameters.overview: Value of the parameter specifying the forced level of dimming / opening sun blinds when comes 'switch on' / 'open' command to devices from association group 1.

parameters.label: Alarm cancelling or turning a device off
parameters.description: Disable all-clear basic set & alarm frame generation
parameters.overview: Set to 0 to disable all-clear basic set & alarm frame generation.  After flooding, device will keep reporting flooding even if flooding ceased.

parameters.label: Interval betw. successive readings of temp sensors
parameters.description: Interval betw. successive readings of temperature
parameters.overview: Interval between successive readings of temperature in seconds.

parameters.label: Insensitiveness to temperature changes.
parameters.overview: Determines a minimum temperature change value (insensitivity level; def: 0,5C), resulting in a temperature report being sent to the main controller, according to the Parameter 10 settings

parameters.label: Alarm BROADCAST
parameters.description: Transmit the alarm or control frame in 'broadcast' mode
parameters.overview:
Transmit the alarm or control frame in 'broadcast' mode.  Information sent in this mode is not repeated by the mesh network.

NOTE: If the broadcast mode of information transmission is activated for a given alarm, then the information is not relayed through the mesh network.  It is only heard by directly reachable devices.

options.label: Flood broadcast active, Tamper broadcast inactive
Flood broadcast inactive, Tamper broadcast active
Flood and Tamper broadcast mode active

parameters.label: Low temperature alarm threshold
parameters.description: Temperature value below which LED indicator blinks
parameters.overview:
The parameter stores a temperature value (def. 15C), below which LED indicator blinks with a colour determined by a Parameter 61 settings. By default the LED indicator blinks blue.

Negative numbers are encoded in U2 (two's compliment) standard.

  • -1 actual temperature = 65535 reported
  • -10000 = 55536
  • -32768 = 32768
  • 32767 = 32767

parameters.label: High temperature alarm threshold
parameters.description: Temperature value above which LED indicator blinks
parameters.overview: The parameter stores a temperature value (def. 35C), above which LED indicator blinks with a colour determined by the Parameter 62 settings. By default the LED indicator blinks red

parameters.label: Low temperature alarm indicator colour
parameters.overview: NOTE: A main controller interprets colours as a sum of it component colours value. Each colours value is a number from 0 to 255. Eg: Indicated colour = 65536 * RED value + 256 * GREEN value + BLUE value

parameters.label: High temperature alarm indicator colour
parameters.description: Default is red (0x00FF0000).  65535 * Red + 256 * Green + Blue
parameters.overview: NOTE: A main controller interprets colours as a sum of it component colours value. Each colours value is a number from 0 to 255. Eg: Indicated colour = 65536 * RED value + 256 * GREEN value + BLUE value

parameters.label: Managing a LED indicator under standard operation
parameters.overview: Parameter determines LED indicator’s operation. Set to 0 turns the indicator off, saving a battery life

options.label: LED indicator doesn’t indicate the temperature

parameters.label: Temperature measurement compensation
parameters.description: Temperature value to compensate between air temp
parameters.overview: Parameter stores a temperature value to be added to or deducted from the current temperature measured by internal temperature sensor in order to compensate the difference between air temperature and temperature at the floor level

parameters.label: Alarm frame sent to 2-nd Assoc Grp
parameters.overview: (MOVEMENT_TAMPER / BUTTON_TAMPER) The device is able to turn on alarms resulting from sensor’s vibrations e.g. when the sensor is moved, or the TMP button released. 2-nd Association Group alarms are not cancelled.

options.label: Button and movement tampers alarm active

parameters.label: Visual and audible alarms duration
parameters.overview:
User can silence the Flood Sensor. Because the Sensor’s alarm may last for a long time, it’s possible to turn off visual and audible alarm signaling to save battery. The parameter determines a time period after which alarm will become “quiet” - still active but the device will go into battery saving mode.  Visual or acoustic alarm will be reactivated after time period specified in parameter 76.  When alarm status ceases, alarm will be turned off immediately.

Value of 0 means visual and accoustic alarms are active indefinitely.  In battery power mode sensor will never go to sleep which may shorten battery life significantly.

parameters.label: Alarm/basic retransmission time when flooding
parameters.description: Time period after which alarm frames will be retransmitted
parameters.overview:
Parameter determines time period after which an alarm frame will be retransmitted. Value of 0 disables alarm frame retransmission.

NOTE: In case the time period set in this parameter is shorter than the one specified in parameter 75, the device will not quiet the alarm; it will remain active.

parameters.label: Flood sensor functionality turned off
parameters.description: Allows for turning of the internal flood sensor
parameters.overview: Allows for turning of the internal flood sensor. Tamper and built in temperature sensor will remain active

options.label: Built in flood sensor TURNED OFF
